Is the test harness also designed for HyperNEAT experiments?  For example=
, XOR isn't a typical benchmark for HyperNEAT (i.e. its network doesn't hav=
e regularities and is quite small).  Also, it would need to come with a Hyp=
erNEAT substrate for XOR.  Is that really the intent or is it more than the=
re aren't really HyperNEAT-centric experiments at least at the moment?

ken=


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <colin.green1@...> wrote:
>
> 20=
10/1/23 Ken <kstanley@...>
> >
> > Colin, I was curious, does the HyperNEAT=
 that you've implemented include any demo experiments?
> >
> 
> The release=
d test harness/gui is currently set up to run XOR, and
> there's Binary-6-M=
ultiplexer in there also. As it stands the test
> harness wires together th=
e various bits of code required to get up and
> running, whereas in SharpNE=
AT 1 that is done inside of classes that
> implement IExperiment, instances=
 of which can be 'plugged in' in a
> more straightforward manner.
>
